comment: Absolutely terrible when it comes to explaining material. Funny stories, yes, but she leaves so much up for interpretation that I literally have to google definitions. When I ask questions (which she "welcomes") she gets flustered or doesn't actually answer them. Very  terrible professor.
Loved Professor Gildea! I would definitely recommend you take her class if the university brings her back. Her test and quizzes come directly for the notes so if you go to class you'll do great.

She is the perfect balance of sweet and sassy. No nonsense lady. Zero tolerance for technology, which helped me learn better. Very interesting class with great stories and a manageable work load. Tests are not terrible. She makes class on a Saturday worth it. I will always remember Ms. Gildea!

I loved Professor Gildea. It was a little bit tougher, but that's the difference between college and high school. She has great stories, and made me laugh and smile. I'm a first year college student, and I really enjoyed her class! :) I will miss her.

Professor Gildea is a "old school" type instructor! No cellphones or lap tops are allowed in class! You are expected to take notes during lectures! Tests come from lecture notes and chapter reading! She gives 3 pop quizzes that are from lecture notes only. She has good stories and a lot of experience. I would take her again, good professor!

Ms. Gildea is wonderful! I will miss her class. She actually has the guts and ability to put her foot down to require handwritten notes and enforce rules. Students who dont put the effort in taking good notes, studying, and read the book do poorly in her class. The class content is very straight forward. No surprises. Amazing lecturer!

Take her! She is so funny and kept our Saturday class awake. She made this semester fly by. I got an A and I was taking my nursing pre requisites so that tells you something.  She makes the class alive and practical to your life so you actually will remember it when you're through with college. Loved her!!

I loved her! Just took the final today & it was easy peezy. Most of exam questions come from lecture so taking notes is needed. If you really chapters also it really is easy to get a high A.  I think she gets a bad wrap from 1st year students who aren't interested in studying for their classes-but thats college...  you get what you put into it.

I like her personality and she has interesting stories. But she asks some off the wall questions for her quizzes and tests that she doesn't cover in the lecture. She is also very hard to takes notes and jumps around on topics. Since her entire class is a lecture, this is very frustrating. I feel that it is very opinionated class, instead of factual

I was so excited to take this class, because I love psychology. But it ended up becoming  unenjoyable for me..:( I love her as a person. She's sassy and funny. But her tests and quizzes were scary. There was way too much content to cover in a day, and she cancelled class twice, leaving two chapters up in the air. I sacrificed my sanity for this.

Ms. Gildea is a wonderful professor. She relates the topic back to her life experiences, which makes it easier to remember topic. Even though, I had her on  Saturday, I never wanted to miss her class. She is strict about cell phones and computers, but you wont want to be on them because she is so interesting. Also, participate she takes points off.
I learned so much that will be helpful in my life. This is also my major and what a great foundation.
loved her lectures -- very informative and helpful to my life
great class

It is very hard to take good notes in her class because of the way she delivers the material. She doesnt really give definitions but will give you a story that explains the term. This makes it very hard to take notes, and you have to research the topic outside of class to get the information.

It seems she has to revise her own lecture after taking her class. It was hard to take notes with so many stories explaining definitions which left a lot up for interpretation. If you don't actively participate and dress up everyday, you will be marked down (including being late).

After the first test (and hours studying) It is clear that participation matters, but She does not give clear definitions to her lecture notes, which are also not completely covered. She also does not answer your questions very well. If you value your grade you will have to go out on your own and research everything from lecture (like I am now).

Has outlines that she does not follow that you will be tested on and goes on tangents (stories) that dont define what is being covered. This left topics and terms not covered. Encourages participation, but doesnt like to answer questions. Presentation seems to have little grading structure, all based on her opinion.

Great Professor! She is very honest, funny and knows what she's talking about. She was totally worth being my only Saturday class. You have the chance for 10 pts extra credit. No real textbook, readings are short. Attendance is integral, Lectures have a very clear guide. Discussion is what makes the class fun. Take her you won't regret it!!

She is such an amazing professor. She is very knowledgable and gives real life examples. She can be funny and always keeps the class interesting. I would take her class again if it weren't on a Saturday.
best class ever - for a saturday class, it was very interesting and I loved going every week

At first when I saw that her classed was offered on a Saturday I hesitated, but after being in her class for 30 mins I was hooked! I LOVE this lady! Amazing stories; fair pop quizzes; READ THE BOOK. I wouldn't say easy A but you won't regret taking her lecture (:

Wonderful teacher! Great stories, firm but really cares that you understand material. Just don't be one of those kids trying to turn stuff in late or with excuses. 1 essay, 1 presentation for extra cred. Study hard for final & midterm. Really enjoyed going to her class!

very straight forward. Kind of harsh personality but she's hilarious. Her class is easy as long as you read the chapters and attend class. Her tests are 50 multiple choice and she makes class very interesting! I would recommend her.
She will NOT accept any assignments late and has no sympathy at all! Also the questions on the tests sometimes will have nothing to do with the lectures!

She is a wonderful teacher! I love her class even though it's on a Saturday. She is very clear in her lectures and you'll know what to expect on the test. Read the chapters and make sure you attend class and you'll be fine.

Probably my favorite teacher so far. I looked forward to coming to her class even though it was on a Saturday. She keeps you interested and interacts with the class. I enjoyed psych because of her. I HIGHLY recommend taking her even if it's a Saturday class.
love her!

I've had her for 2 classes now & absolutely LOVE! She's straightforward and seems hard BUT she works with you if you just talk to her! Her tests for this class were straight from lectures. DO take notes on any side stories she tells you because you never know if it'll show up on a pop quiz or test. GREAT educator. I love that she doesn't use PPTs

On a pt. system, up to 9 extra credit pts. So, basically make all b's & still pull off an A if you do the extra credit!No hw, no presentation, no assisgnments to complete.3 tests and 3 pop quizes. Attendence is mandatory but you won't want to miss a class anyways! Class particapation counts for alot! Letures go along with the book. Can record them!

Good story teller, but does not make use of technology. Tests do not go along with the lectures, you have to read the book, study notes test is over much more than what is discussed in class and on her outline handout.
she builds you up for a good nursing career

She is wonderful!! She is so funny too. She does a great job telling stories and examples to help you remember the point its related to. Read the material. If you read, lectures are very enjoyable, and easy to follow and participate. Come to class. Turn your phone off/on silent. Being such an amazing professor she deserves the respect.

Two main things bring your recorder and attend every class if you really want to make an A. Taking notes is not enough. Also, listen to the lecture before the next class. Pop quizes procede a lecture always study just in case. Not an easy A class but fun. Pay attention to stories they'll be on pop quizes. Nothing is insignificant all details count!

She is witty and keeps lectures interesting.  Her exams are not easy and are more applied theory questions rather than 100% from the book.  You must read the book and listen to her lectures or you will not pass her class.  I did enjoy the class very much but it is not an easy A.  She is fair.

she is too good. she reads alot, when it is the time to praise any one she will do it, very straight forward and always has appropriate examples to go with her points that she is trying to make. if u want to win her trust and support talk to her and indulge yourself to what she says. listen to her carefully because u nvr knw wht cud be on the test
Great Professor. She tells good jokes and stories! Listen to her personal stories as she will actually throw a question or two on a quiz. Overall, just fabulous!

Fantastic teacher! She is knowledgeable, witty and direct. She has a very humerous personality that helps when discussing some of the material. Attend class, pay attention, study, & you'll do well. I would take all of her classes!

She is a really funny, interesting professor, her class is never boring. There are pop quizes and 3 tests. Tests are quite hard, you have to study to get good grades. If you take good notes and read the textbooks, you would pass the test. I recommend taking this professor, this is the best class i am taking so far.Love her lecture.

Loooooooove her! She's hilarious and sarcastic but she really does a fantastic job explaining things. She brings in news articles related to psychology. She just keeps it interesting and goes above and beyond, in my opinion.

Ms.Gildea was simply a thrill.. She speaks her mind and there's nothing you can do about. There was never a boring day in her class. Coming to class is madatory, but she won't miss you if you do. She says plenty of things that you'll remember for years to come.. I def.. recommend her!!!
Great name!

She knows her job.In class she is incharge.The topics she is in control I got on the DEANS list because of the way she taught me. she does not hesistat to use her family examples to make sure you get it. I just love her. If I were rich I will buy her a  green jargua from car talk on NPR.(eze fall 2008)

She's incredibly funny!! Makes class fun and entertaining, which makes it fun to learn. She makes funny jokes and tells great stories! A bit challenging for a gen. ed. course but if you read and look over the notes you'll be good. She even gives you an outline for each chapter. Take her.

Prof. Gildea is hilarious! I looked forward to her classes each Saturday. She does not utilize WebCT, which rather sucks, but she makes up for it in her entertaining lectures. I taped her lectures b/c she does talk fast. Read the book before class, take good notes, go to class and you will make an A. She is a great asset to KSU!

Attend every class, take good notes, study those notes once or twice a week and you'll make an A. It's that simple. The reading assignments are very short and the tests are taken straight from lecture. Do the extra credit presentation!! Gildea is a nice lady and she made psychology interesting.

I liked her so much I took her 1101 and 2105 during the same semester.  SHE'S FANTASTIC.  Be sure to attend every class and take notes with the outlines she provides.  Her tests are straight from the lectures, but are sometimes confusing, so know examples of the things she talks about in class!  Read the book for discussion and tests.

She's the coolest teacher ever. If you're shy or easily offended or lack a sense of humour, you probably won't like her but I loved her. She really cares about teaching you and she really uses all that she's learned about a person's mind in her teaching.Class is hard if you don't study but she makes you want to do well.Wish she'd teach more classes
dO OT TAKE HER!!!

I have her for a Saturday class and she gives out pop quizzes. Not only that but unless your one of her favorite students, then she doesn't remember who you are no mater how many times you talk to her, I had to go to a funeral and had proof she didn't care and didn't bother to help. I love psychology, but I will never take her class or recommend he

A great teacher.  Attendance is mandatory.  Textbook is awful and required.  If you attend all classes and take good notes, you will barely have to open the book.  There are pop quizes, but only over the material covered in the previous class.  Very interesting, class is never boring.

She is by far one of the best professors I've had. She is fun and lively and knows well her stuff. Classes never boring. She makes sure you understand with a lot of real stories. I would take her again

Very interesting class. Some material not from textbook - attendance important! Gives random quizzes that can't be made up if you miss/arrive late. Loves to talk about family and personal stories that are interesting/funny. Sense of humor can be taken wrong way if you are thin skinned. A bit judgmental but suppose that is profession.

Not easy, but very interesting. Extremely witty (grown-up humor). Study the book for tests, study the notes for pop quizzes, show up. Pay attention to details no matter how minor they may seem (cartoons, articles, stories, etc.) Teaches from experience. You will learn something if you allow yourself to.

She is one of my favorite teachers ever. Smart, funny, lively. I loved going to this class. She made me interested in psych, and you can tell she loves it...and will make you love it, too. I didn't record, but I'm sure it helps some people. Just take great notes and you'll do fine; remember to highlight anything she tells you is important.

Ms. Gildae is a GREAT teacher! Her class has been one of my favorite overall college experiences. Her lectures are so interesting you don't even realize you are learning. The biggest tip I can give you is RECORD the lectures. Then listen to them the week before the test and type them out. You'll be glad you did. I got an A doing this.

her class was very engaging.  If you are interested in psychology, you will like her class a lot.  She does well at teaching the material.  Be careful though, she uses a lot of personal examples and tends to push her own opinion into the material here and there... and with all respect, some of that advice was a little sketchy in my opinion : )

excellent, excellent teacher... i can't say enough good things about her. she's charismatic, she's interesting, and she's definately into what she does. this was the one class that i really looked forward to going to, and usually left feeling unusually good. wooooooweeeeeeeeeeeeee.

She is an awesome teacher and as long as you study you won't have any problems. She is a stickler for detail so listen close. I recorded the lectures then typed them later, this helped, I could pay attention in class better and didn't miss key points.  Definately wacked, she knows it and loves it. A+++

Loved her. I had her once a week, which meant extremely long lectures...but I always wanted to come to class because I loved her funny stories! Interesting lectures, fun activities. Oh yeah--DO THE EXTRA CREDIT PROJECT/PRESENTATION!!! You will regret it if you don't! She's pretty crazy but I would try and have her again!
Excellent teacher    tells great stories to make a point  funny lady

She is really interesting and has examples to go along with everything she teaches, usually from her own life or at least something that everybody will understand.  3 tests & 3 quizzes but she drops the lowest quiz.
I really liked this class and she is really interesting.  If you study its not hard to make an A.  Multiple choice exams.

She was a good teacher. Difficult at times, but if you care at all about the class you'll do fine. She may be a little crazy though... watch out. Why she is a psychologist i don't know. good teacher though
Hilarious, love her stories, but she's a little obsessed with Freud.
good teacher, make sure u read the chapter for the test and study the outlines and you will do great... pop quizzes are easy if pay attention to her stories
